medical_history.chief_complaint: Recent onset of right lower quadrant pain, fever, and anorexia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began recently with right lower quadrant pain and were associated with fever and decreased appetite. The patient reports an increase in lower abdominal pain one day prior to admission, which worsens with movement. There is no association with eating, and the patient denies nausea or vomiting. Urinary frequency without dysuria was noted, but bowel movements remain normal.
medical_history.family_history: Father had myocardial infarction at an early age; no history of bowel disease.
